font-preview.defaultTab.description: Controls the starting tab of the preview.
enumDescriptions: The preview will always start on the "Preview" tab.
The preview will always start on the "Features" tab (if present).
The preview will always start on the "Glyphs" tab (if present).
The preview will always start on the "Waterfall" tab.
The preview will always start on the "Type Yourself" tab.
The preview will always start on the "License" tab (if present).

font-preview.useWorker.description: If enabled, VS Code will try to use a worker when loading the font. Fonts may load faster, but you may also see a small shift while the font loads. Disable this setting if you notice any weird behavior.

font-preview.showGlyphWidth.description: Show the glyph's width in the cell.

font-preview.showGlyphIndex.description: Show the index of the glyph in the left corner of the cell.

font-preview.sampleTextPaths.title: Sample Text Paths
font-preview.sampleTextPaths.markdownDescription: Define custom sample texts to be added in the "Preview" tab. Provide the path to a YML file for the sample to be loaded (must restart VS COde after adding/removing a path). See [this link](https://github.com/ctcuff/vscode-font-preview) for an explanation on how the yaml should be structured.
